us-math.name: Mathematics
us-math.description: US K-5 Mathematics curriculum based on Common Core State Standards
us-math.subject: MATH

us-k-math.name: Kindergarten Mathematics
us-k-math.description: Foundational math skills for kindergarten students
us-k-math.subject: MATH

us-k-math-cc.name: Counting and Cardinality
us-k-math-cc.description: Know number names and the count sequence
us-k-math-cc.subject: MATH

us-k-math-cc-1.name: Count to 100 by ones and by tens
us-k-math-cc-1.description: Count to 100 by ones and by tens
us-k-math-cc-1.subject: MATH

us-k-math-cc-2.name: Count forward beginning from a given number
us-k-math-cc-2.description: Count forward beginning from a given number within the known sequence
us-k-math-cc-2.subject: MATH

us-g1-math-oa.name: Operations and Algebraic Thinking
us-g1-math-oa.description: Represent and solve problems involving addition and subtraction
us-g1-math-oa.subject: MATH

us-g1-math-oa-1.name: Use addition and subtraction within 20
us-g1-math-oa-1.description: Use addition and subtraction within 20 to solve word problems
us-g1-math-oa-1.subject: MATH

us-g2-math-oa.name: Operations and Algebraic Thinking
us-g2-math-oa.description: Represent and solve problems involving addition and subtraction
us-g2-math-oa.subject: MATH

us-g2-math-oa-1.name: Use addition and subtraction within 100
us-g2-math-oa-1.description: Use addition and subtraction within 100 to solve one- and two-step word problems
us-g2-math-oa-1.subject: MATH

us-g3-math-oa.name: Operations and Algebraic Thinking
us-g3-math-oa.description: Represent and solve problems involving multiplication and division
us-g3-math-oa.subject: MATH

us-g3-math-oa-1.name: Interpret products of whole numbers
us-g3-math-oa-1.description: Interpret products of whole numbers as equal groups
us-g3-math-oa-1.subject: MATH

us-g3-math-oa-2.name: Interpret whole-number quotients
us-g3-math-oa-2.description: Interpret whole-number quotients of whole numbers
us-g3-math-oa-2.subject: MATH

us-g3-math-nf.name: Number and Operations—Fractions
us-g3-math-nf.description: Develop understanding of fractions as numbers
us-g3-math-nf.subject: MATH

us-g3-math-nf-1.name: Understand a fraction as a number
us-g3-math-nf-1.description: Understand a fraction 1/b as the quantity formed by 1 part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts
us-g3-math-nf-1.subject: MATH

us-g4-math-oa.name: Operations and Algebraic Thinking
us-g4-math-oa.description: Use the four operations with whole numbers to solve problems
us-g4-math-oa.subject: MATH

us-g4-math-oa-1.name: Interpret multiplication equations as comparisons
us-g4-math-oa-1.description: Interpret a multiplication equation as a comparison
us-g4-math-oa-1.subject: MATH

us-g4-math-nf.name: Number and Operations—Fractions
us-g4-math-nf.description: Extend understanding of fraction equivalence and ordering
us-g4-math-nf.subject: MATH

us-g4-math-nf-1.name: Explain why fractions are equivalent
us-g4-math-nf-1.description: Explain why a fraction a/b is equivalent to a fraction (n×a)/(n×b)
us-g4-math-nf-1.subject: MATH

us-g5-math-oa-1.name: Use parentheses and brackets in expressions
us-g5-math-oa-1.description: Use parentheses, brackets, or braces in numerical expressions
us-g5-math-oa-1.subject: MATH

us-g5-math-nf.name: Number and Operations—Fractions
us-g5-math-nf.description: Use equivalent fractions as a strategy to add and subtract fractions
us-g5-math-nf.subject: MATH

us-g5-math-nf-1.name: Add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators
us-g5-math-nf-1.description: Add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators by replacing given fractions with equivalent fractions
us-g5-math-nf-1.subject: MATH

us-ela.name: English Language Arts
us-ela.description: US K-5 English Language Arts curriculum based on Common Core State Standards
us-ela.subject: ENGLISH

us-k-ela.name: Kindergarten English Language Arts
us-k-ela.description: Foundational literacy skills for kindergarten students
us-k-ela.subject: ENGLISH

us-k-ela-rf.name: Reading: Foundational Skills
us-k-ela-rf.description: Print concepts, phonological awareness, phonics and word recognition, fluency
us-k-ela-rf.subject: ENGLISH

us-k-ela-rf-1.name: Demonstrate understanding of print concepts
us-k-ela-rf-1.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print
us-k-ela-rf-1.subject: ENGLISH

us-k-ela-rf-2.name: Demonstrate understanding of phonological awareness
us-k-ela-rf-2.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes)
us-k-ela-rf-2.subject: ENGLISH

us-k-ela-sl.name: Speaking and Listening
us-k-ela-sl.description: Comprehension and collaboration, presentation of knowledge and ideas
us-k-ela-sl.subject: ENGLISH

us-k-ela-sl-1.name: Participate in collaborative conversations
us-k-ela-sl-1.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics
us-k-ela-sl-1.subject: ENGLISH

us-g1-ela.name: Grade 1 English Language Arts
us-g1-ela.description: First grade English Language Arts curriculum
us-g1-ela.subject: ENGLISH

us-g1-ela-rf.name: Reading: Foundational Skills
us-g1-ela-rf.description: Print concepts, phonological awareness, phonics and word recognition, fluency
us-g1-ela-rf.subject: ENGLISH

us-g1-ela-rf-1.name: Demonstrate understanding of print organization
us-g1-ela-rf-1.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print
us-g1-ela-rf-1.subject: ENGLISH

us-g1-ela-rl.name: Reading: Literature
us-g1-ela-rl.description: Key ideas and details, craft and structure, integration of knowledge and ideas
us-g1-ela-rl.subject: ENGLISH

us-g1-ela-rl-1.name: Ask and answer questions about key details
us-g1-ela-rl-1.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text
us-g1-ela-rl-1.subject: ENGLISH

us-g2-ela.name: Grade 2 English Language Arts
us-g2-ela.description: Second grade English Language Arts curriculum
us-g2-ela.subject: ENGLISH

us-g2-ela-rl.name: Reading: Literature
us-g2-ela-rl.description: Key ideas and details, craft and structure, integration of knowledge and ideas
us-g2-ela-rl.subject: ENGLISH

us-g2-ela-rl-1.name: Ask and answer questions for comprehension
us-g2-ela-rl-1.description: Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate understanding
us-g2-ela-rl-1.subject: ENGLISH

us-g2-ela-w.name: Writing
us-g2-ela-w.description: Text types and purposes, production and distribution of writing, research to build knowledge
us-g2-ela-w.subject: ENGLISH

us-g2-ela-w-1.name: Write opinion pieces
us-g2-ela-w-1.description: Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic, state an opinion, and provide reasons
us-g2-ela-w-1.subject: ENGLISH

us-g3-ela.name: Grade 3 English Language Arts
us-g3-ela.description: Third grade English Language Arts curriculum
us-g3-ela.subject: ENGLISH

us-g3-ela-rl.name: Reading: Literature
us-g3-ela-rl.description: Key ideas and details, craft and structure, integration of knowledge and ideas
us-g3-ela-rl.subject: ENGLISH

us-g3-ela-rl-1.name: Ask and answer questions about texts
us-g3-ela-rl-1.description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text
us-g3-ela-rl-1.subject: ENGLISH

us-g3-ela-w.name: Writing
us-g3-ela-w.description: Text types and purposes, production and distribution of writing, research to build knowledge
us-g3-ela-w.subject: ENGLISH

us-g3-ela-w-1.name: Write opinion pieces with supporting details
us-g3-ela-w-1.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons
us-g3-ela-w-1.subject: ENGLISH

us-g4-ela.name: Grade 4 English Language Arts
us-g4-ela.description: Fourth grade English Language Arts curriculum
us-g4-ela.subject: ENGLISH

us-g4-ela-rl.name: Reading: Literature
us-g4-ela-rl.description: Key ideas and details, craft and structure, integration of knowledge and ideas
us-g4-ela-rl.subject: ENGLISH

us-g4-ela-rl-1.name: Refer to details and examples when explaining text
us-g4-ela-rl-1.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences
us-g4-ela-rl-1.subject: ENGLISH

us-g4-ela-w.name: Writing
us-g4-ela-w.description: Text types and purposes, production and distribution of writing, research to build knowledge
us-g4-ela-w.subject: ENGLISH

us-g4-ela-w-1.name: Write opinion pieces with organized reasons
us-g4-ela-w-1.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information
us-g4-ela-w-1.subject: ENGLISH

us-g5-ela.name: Grade 5 English Language Arts
us-g5-ela.description: Fifth grade English Language Arts curriculum
us-g5-ela.subject: ENGLISH

us-g5-ela-rl.name: Reading: Literature
us-g5-ela-rl.description: Key ideas and details, craft and structure, integration of knowledge and ideas
us-g5-ela-rl.subject: ENGLISH

us-g5-ela-rl-1.name: Quote accurately from text when explaining
us-g5-ela-rl-1.description: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences
us-g5-ela-rl-1.subject: ENGLISH

us-g5-ela-w.name: Writing
us-g5-ela-w.description: Text types and purposes, production and distribution of writing, research to build knowledge
us-g5-ela-w.subject: ENGLISH

us-g5-ela-w-1.name: Write opinion pieces with logically ordered reasons
us-g5-ela-w-1.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information
us-g5-ela-w-1.subject: ENGLISH

us-science.name: Science
us-science.description: Curriculum for K-12 Science in the United States, based on the Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS).
us-science.subject: SCIENCE

us-k-science.name: Kindergarten Science
us-k-science.description: Introduction to scientific concepts for Kindergarten, focusing on forces, organisms, and weather.
us-k-science.subject: SCIENCE

us-k-ps.name: Physical Sciences (PS)
us-k-ps.description: Motion and Stability: Forces and Interactions.
us-k-ps.subject: SCIENCE

us-k-ls.name: Life Sciences (LS)
us-k-ls.description: From Molecules to Organisms: Structures and Processes.
us-k-ls.subject: SCIENCE

us-k-ess.name: Earth and Space Sciences (ESS)
us-k-ess.description: Earth's Systems and Earth and Human Activity.
us-k-ess.subject: SCIENCE

us-k-ps2-1.name: Plan and conduct an investigation to compare the effects of pushes and pulls on the motion of an object. (K-PS2-1)
us-k-ps2-1.description: Plan and conduct an investigation to compare the effects of different strengths or different directions of pushes and pulls on the motion of an object.
us-k-ps2-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-k-ls1-1.name: Use observations to describe patterns of what plants and animals need to survive. (K-LS1-1)
us-k-ls1-1.description: Use observations to describe patterns of what plants and animals (including humans) need to survive.
us-k-ls1-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-k-ess2-1.name: Use and share observations of local weather conditions to describe patterns over time. (K-ESS2-1)
us-k-ess2-1.description: Use and share observations of local weather conditions to describe patterns over time.
us-k-ess2-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-k-ess3-3.name: Communicate solutions that will reduce the impact of humans on the local environment. (K-ESS3-3)
us-k-ess3-3.description: Communicate solutions that will reduce the impact of humans on the land, water, air, and/or other living things in the local environment.
us-k-ess3-3.subject: SCIENCE

us-g1-science.name: Grade 1 Science
us-g1-science.description: Exploring waves, structures and functions of organisms, and space systems for Grade 1.
us-g1-science.subject: SCIENCE

us-g1-ps.name: Physical Sciences (PS)
us-g1-ps.description: Waves and Their Applications in Technologies for Information Transfer.
us-g1-ps.subject: SCIENCE

us-g1-ls.name: Life Sciences (LS)
us-g1-ls.description: From Molecules to Organisms: Structures and Processes; Heredity: Inheritance and Variation of Traits.
us-g1-ls.subject: SCIENCE

us-g1-ps4-1.name: Plan and conduct investigations about sound and vibrating materials. (1-PS4-1)
us-g1-ps4-1.description: Plan and conduct investigations to provide evidence that vibrating materials can make sound and that sound can make materials vibrate.
us-g1-ps4-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g1-ls1-1.name: Use materials to design a solution to a human problem by mimicking how plants and/or animals use their external parts. (1-LS1-1)
us-g1-ls1-1.description: Use materials to design a solution to a human problem by mimicking how plants and/or animals use their external parts to help them survive, grow, and meet their needs.
us-g1-ls1-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g1-ess1-1.name: Use observations of the sun, moon, and stars to describe patterns that can be predicted. (1-ESS1-1)
us-g1-ess1-1.description: Use observations of the sun, moon, and stars to describe patterns that can be predicted.
us-g1-ess1-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g2-science.name: Grade 2 Science
us-g2-science.description: Investigating properties of matter, ecosystems, and Earth's systems for Grade 2.
us-g2-science.subject: SCIENCE

us-g2-ess.name: Earth and Space Sciences (ESS)
us-g2-ess.description: Earth's Systems: Processes that Shape the Earth.
us-g2-ess.subject: SCIENCE

us-g2-ps1-1.name: Plan and conduct an investigation to describe and classify different kinds of materials by their observable properties. (2-PS1-1)
us-g2-ps1-1.description: Plan and conduct an investigation to describe and classify different kinds of materials by their observable properties.
us-g2-ps1-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g2-ls2-2.name: Develop a simple model that mimics the function of an animal in dispersing seeds or pollinating plants. (2-LS2-2)
us-g2-ls2-2.description: Develop a simple model that mimics the function of an animal in dispersing seeds or pollinating plants.
us-g2-ls2-2.subject: SCIENCE

us-g2-ess2-1.name: Compare multiple solutions designed to slow or prevent wind or water from changing the shape of the land. (2-ESS2-1)
us-g2-ess2-1.description: Compare multiple solutions designed to slow or prevent wind or water from changing the shape of the land.
us-g2-ess2-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g3-science.name: Grade 3 Science
us-g3-science.description: Investigating forces, life cycles, ecosystems, and weather for Grade 3.
us-g3-science.subject: SCIENCE

us-g3-ps2-1.name: Plan and conduct an investigation to provide evidence of the effects of balanced and unbalanced forces on the motion of an object. (3-PS2-1)
us-g3-ps2-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g3-ls1-1.name: Develop models to describe that organisms have unique and diverse life cycles but all have in common birth, growth, reproduction, and death. (3-LS1-1)
us-g3-ls1-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g3-ess2-1.name: Represent data in tables and graphical displays to describe typical weather conditions expected in a particular season. (3-ESS2-1)
us-g3-ess2-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g4-science.name: Grade 4 Science
us-g4-science.description: Exploring energy, waves, organism structures, and Earth processes for Grade 4.
us-g4-science.subject: SCIENCE

us-g4-ps3-1.name: Use evidence to construct an explanation relating the speed of an object to the energy of that object. (4-PS3-1)
us-g4-ps3-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g4-ls1-1.name: Construct an argument that plants and animals have internal and external structures that function to support survival, growth, behavior, and reproduction. (4-LS1-1)
us-g4-ls1-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g4-ess1-1.name: Identify evidence from patterns in rock formations and fossils in rock layers to explain changes in a landscape over time. (4-ESS1-1)
us-g4-ess1-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g5-science.name: Grade 5 Science
us-g5-science.description: Investigating matter, energy flow in ecosystems, and Earth's systems for Grade 5.
us-g5-science.subject: SCIENCE

us-g5-ps1-1.name: Develop a model to describe that matter is made of particles too small to be seen. (5-PS1-1)
us-g5-ps1-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g5-ls2-1.name: Develop a model to describe the movement of matter among plants, animals, decomposers, and the environment. (5-LS2-1)
us-g5-ls2-1.subject: SCIENCE

us-g5-ess1-2.name: Represent data in graphical displays to reveal patterns of daily changes in length and direction of shadows, day and night, and the seasonal appearance of some stars in the night sky. (5-ESS1-2)
us-g5-ess1-2.subject: SCIENCE

us-history.name: History
us-history.description: Curriculum for K-12 History in the United States, covering American history, world history, civics, and cultural understanding.
us-history.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-k-history.name: Kindergarten History
us-k-history.description: Introduction to history focusing on personal identity, family, and community.
us-k-history.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-k-history-lo1.name: Describe personal characteristics and family traditions.
us-k-history-lo1.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-k-history-lo2.name: Identify how we learn about the past through family stories and photographs.
us-k-history-lo2.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g1-history.name: Grade 1 History
us-g1-history.description: Focus on family history, school traditions, and community helpers.
us-g1-history.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g2-history.name: Grade 2 History
us-g2-history.description: Introduction to community history and American symbols.
us-g2-history.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g3-history.name: Grade 3 History
us-g3-history.description: Focus on local history, Native American cultures, and early explorers.
us-g3-history.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g3-history-lo1.name: Compare and contrast different Native American cultural groups.
us-g3-history-lo1.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g3-history-lo2.name: Describe how Native Americans adapted to their environments.
us-g3-history-lo2.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g4-history.name: Grade 4 History
us-g4-history.description: Study of state history, including settlement, development, and key historical figures.
us-g4-history.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g5-history.name: Grade 5 History
us-g5-history.description: Focus on early American history including exploration, colonization, and the Revolutionary War.
us-g5-history.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g5-history-lo1.name: Describe the reasons for European exploration and colonization of North America.
us-g5-history-lo1.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g5-history-lo2.name: Compare the different colonial regions and their characteristics.
us-g5-history-lo2.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-geography.name: Geography
us-geography.description: Curriculum for K-12 Geography in the United States, covering spatial thinking, places and regions, physical systems, human systems, and environment-society interactions.
us-geography.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-k-geo.name: Kindergarten Geography
us-k-geo.description: Introduction to geography, focusing on maps, personal location, and the immediate environment.
us-k-geo.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-k-geo-lo1.name: Identify a map and a globe as representations of Earth.
us-k-geo-lo1.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-k-geo-lo2.name: Describe the location of self and objects in the classroom.
us-k-geo-lo2.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g1-geo.name: Grade 1 Geography
us-g1-geo.description: Focus on the geography of the local community.
us-g1-geo.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g1-geo-lo1.name: Create and use simple maps of the classroom and school.
us-g1-geo-lo1.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g1-geo-lo2.name: Identify natural and human-made features in the community.
us-g1-geo-lo2.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g2-geo.name: Grade 2 Geography
us-g2-geo.description: Expanding to understand continents, oceans, and different environments.
us-g2-geo.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g2-geo-lo1.name: Locate and name the seven continents and five oceans.
us-g2-geo-lo1.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g2-geo-lo2.name: Compare different kinds of communities (urban, suburban, rural).
us-g2-geo-lo2.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g3-geo.name: Grade 3 Geography
us-g3-geo.description: Focus on the geography of the local state and region.
us-g3-geo.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g3-geo-lo1.name: Use maps to identify major cities, rivers, and landforms in their state.
us-g3-geo-lo1.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g3-geo-lo2.name: Explain how the environment affects human activity in their region.
us-g3-geo-lo2.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g4-geo.name: Grade 4 Geography
us-g4-geo.description: Study of the physical and human geography of the different regions of the United States.
us-g4-geo.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g4-geo-lo1.name: Locate the major regions of the United States and identify their states.
us-g4-geo-lo1.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g4-geo-lo2.name: Compare the climate, landforms, and natural resources of different U.S. regions.
us-g4-geo-lo2.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g5-geo.name: Grade 5 Geography
us-g5-geo.description: Focus on the geography of the United States in relation to the Western Hemisphere.
us-g5-geo.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g5-geo-lo1.name: Use latitude and longitude to locate places in the Western Hemisphere.
us-g5-geo-lo1.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-g5-geo-lo2.name: Describe major patterns of human settlement in the Americas.
us-g5-geo-lo2.subject: SOCIAL_STUDIES

us-pe.name: Physical Education
us-pe.description: Curriculum for K-12 Physical Education in the United States, focusing on motor skills, health-related fitness, and personal and social responsibility.
us-pe.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-k-pe.name: Kindergarten Physical Education
us-k-pe.description: Introduction to basic motor skills, movement concepts, and cooperative play.
us-k-pe.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-k-pe-ms-lo1.name: Demonstrate basic locomotor skills (running, jumping, hopping).
us-k-pe-ms-lo1.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-g1-pe.name: Grade 1 Physical Education
us-g1-pe.description: Refining locomotor skills and introducing object control.
us-g1-pe.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-g1-pe-oc-lo1.name: Toss and catch a large ball with two hands.
us-g1-pe-oc-lo1.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-g2-pe.name: Grade 2 Physical Education
us-g2-pe.description: Combining motor skills and applying them in simple games.
us-g2-pe.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-g2-pe-hf-lo1.name: Identify activities that increase heart rate.
us-g2-pe-hf-lo1.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-g3-pe.name: Grade 3 Physical Education
us-g3-pe.description: Focus on cooperative games and applying skills with partners.
us-g3-pe.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-g3-pe-psr-lo1.name: Work cooperatively with a partner or small group.
us-g3-pe-psr-lo1.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-g4-pe.name: Grade 4 Physical Education
us-g4-pe.description: Introduction to fitness concepts and simple game tactics.
us-g4-pe.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-g4-pe-hf-lo1.name: Describe the components of fitness (cardio, strength, flexibility).
us-g4-pe-hf-lo1.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-g5-pe.name: Grade 5 Physical Education
us-g5-pe.description: Applying skills to modified sports and lifetime activities.
us-g5-pe.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-g5-pe-sa-lo1.name: Demonstrate mature form for skills in a modified sport (e.g., dribbling in basketball).
us-g5-pe-sa-lo1.subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

us-music.name: Music
us-music.description: Curriculum for K-12 Music education in the United States, covering musical literacy, creative expression, performance, and cultural understanding.
us-music.subject: MUSIC

us-k-music.name: Kindergarten Music
us-k-music.description: Musical exploration focusing on basic elements, singing, rhythm instruments, movement, and listening for Kindergarten.
us-k-music.subject: MUSIC

us-k-music-ma-lo1.name: Listening to different types of music
us-k-music-ma-lo1.subject: MUSIC

us-g1-music.name: Grade 1 Music
us-g1-music.description: Developing understanding of beat, rhythm, pitch matching, and cultural music for Grade 1.
us-g1-music.subject: MUSIC

us-g1-music-me-lo1.name: Explore beat and rhythm through movement
us-g1-music-me-lo1.subject: MUSIC

us-g1-music-svd-lo1.name: Matching pitch and singing in tune
us-g1-music-svd-lo1.subject: MUSIC

us-g1-music-ie-lo1.name: Explore classroom instruments and proper technique
us-g1-music-ie-lo1.subject: MUSIC

us-g1-music-mm-lo1.name: Acting out songs and musical stories
us-g1-music-mm-lo1.subject: MUSIC

us-g1-music-ma-lo1.name: Explore music from different cultures and places
us-g1-music-ma-lo1.subject: MUSIC

us-g2-music.name: Grade 2 Music
us-g2-music.description: Introduction to melody, part-singing, keyboard/recorder, and instrument recognition for Grade 2.
us-g2-music.subject: MUSIC

us-g2-music-me-lo1.name: Explore melody and simple pitch patterns
us-g2-music-me-lo1.subject: MUSIC

us-g3-music.name: Grade 3 Music

us-g5-ca.description: Focusing on movement, drawing techniques, animation, and art as communication for Grade 5.

us-g3-cs.description: Building skills in hardware, software, internet, programming, and data for Grade 3.

us-g3-cs-in-lo1.subject: COMPUTER_SCIENCE

us-k-le.description: Basic self-care and safety skills for Kindergarten.

us-k-le-pch-lo1.name: Basic hygiene (brushing teeth, washing hands, dressing)
us-k-le-pch-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-k-le-ses-lo1.name: Home safety rules and identifying trusted adults
us-k-le-ses-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-k-le-mb-lo1.name: Identify coins and bills, understand "buying" things
us-k-le-mb-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-g1-le.name: Grade 1 Life Essentials
us-g1-le.description: Expanding on basic self-care and safety for Grade 1.
us-g1-le.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-g1-le-pch-lo1.name: Healthy eating choices and food safety basics
us-g1-le-pch-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-g1-le-ses-lo1.name: Basic first aid (cleaning cuts, getting help)
us-g1-le-ses-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-g1-le-ssr-lo1.name: Friendship basics and treating others kindly
us-g1-le-ssr-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-g2-le.name: Grade 2 Life Essentials
us-g2-le.description: Further development of self-care and safety for Grade 2.
us-g2-le.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-g2-le-pch-lo1.name: Understanding body parts, privacy, and appropriate touch
us-g2-le-pch-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-g2-le-mb-lo1.name: Simple saving concepts (piggy bank, delayed gratification)
us-g2-le-mb-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-g3-le-ser-lo1.name: Home alone safety rules and emergency contacts
us-g3-le-ser-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-g3-le-mcs-lo1.name: Counting money, making change, simple budgeting

us-g3-le-ls-lo1.name: Basic cooking safety and simple recipes
us-g3-le-ls-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-g4-le-hba-lo1.name: Basic anatomy and how bodies grow/change
us-g4-le-hba-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-g4-le-ls-lo1.name: Laundry basics and taking care of belongings
us-g4-le-ls-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-g5-le-hba-lo1.name: Introduction to puberty and body changes
us-g5-le-hba-lo1.subject: LIFE_ESSENTIALS

us-mental-wellness.name: Mental Wellness
us-mental-wellness.description: Curriculum for Mental Wellness in the United States, focusing on emotional literacy, self-regulation, social skills, resilience, and mental health awareness across K-12.
us-mental-wellness.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-k-mw.name: Kindergarten Mental Wellness
us-k-mw.description: Foundational mental wellness concepts for Kindergarten.
us-k-mw.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-k-mw-ea-lo1.name: Identify basic emotions (happy, sad, mad, scared)
us-k-mw-ea-lo1.description: Students will be able to identify and name basic emotions like happy, sad, mad, and scared in themselves and others.
us-k-mw-ea-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-k-mw-sr-lo1.name: Use "calm down" strategies (counting, deep breaths)
us-k-mw-sr-lo1.description: Students will learn and practice simple "calm down" strategies such as counting or taking deep breaths.
us-k-mw-sr-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-k-mw-sc-lo1.name: Identify trusted adults and safe spaces
us-k-mw-sc-lo1.description: Students will be able to identify trusted adults in their lives and safe spaces at school and home.
us-k-mw-sc-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-k-mw-rb-lo1.name: Understand that mistakes help us learn
us-k-mw-rb-lo1.description: Students will understand that making mistakes is a normal part of learning and growth.
us-k-mw-rb-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g1-mw.name: Grade 1 Mental Wellness
us-g1-mw.description: Continuing foundational mental wellness for Grade 1.
us-g1-mw.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g1-mw-ea-lo1.name: Name 6-8 emotions and describe what causes them
us-g1-mw-ea-lo1.description: Students will be able to name 6-8 different emotions and describe situations or triggers that might cause them.
us-g1-mw-ea-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g1-mw-sr-lo1.name: Practice simple mindfulness (5-4-3-2-1 sensory technique)
us-g1-mw-sr-lo1.description: Students will practice a simple mindfulness technique like the 5-4-3-2-1 sensory grounding exercise.
us-g1-mw-sr-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g1-mw-sc-lo1.name: Practice kind communication ("I feel..." statements)
us-g1-mw-sc-lo1.description: Students will practice using "I feel..." statements to communicate their emotions kindly and respectfully.
us-g1-mw-sc-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g1-mw-rb-lo1.name: Try again after setbacks with adult support
us-g1-mw-rb-lo1.description: Students will learn to try again after experiencing a setback, with support from an adult.
us-g1-mw-rb-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g2-mw.name: Grade 2 Mental Wellness
us-g2-mw.description: Further foundational mental wellness for Grade 2.
us-g2-mw.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g2-mw-ea-lo1.name: Recognize that emotions change and are temporary
us-g2-mw-ea-lo1.description: Students will recognize that emotions can change over time and are often temporary states.
us-g2-mw-ea-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g2-mw-sr-lo1.name: Choose appropriate coping strategies for different situations
us-g2-mw-sr-lo1.description: Students will learn to choose and apply appropriate coping strategies for different challenging situations.
us-g2-mw-sr-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g2-mw-sc-lo1.name: Show empathy through listening and helping
us-g2-mw-sc-lo1.description: Students will practice showing empathy by actively listening to others and offering help when appropriate.
us-g2-mw-sc-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g2-mw-rb-lo1.name: Celebrate effort, not just outcomes
us-g2-mw-rb-lo1.description: Students will learn to celebrate their effort and the process of learning, not just the final outcome.
us-g2-mw-rb-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g3-mw.name: Grade 3 Mental Wellness
us-g3-mw.description: Mental wellness skill development for Grade 3.
us-g3-mw.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g3-mw-sm.name: Stress Management
us-g3-mw-sm.description: Developing healthy ways to cope with stress.
us-g3-mw-sm.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g3-mw-gm.name: Growth Mindset
us-g3-mw-gm.description: Fostering a belief in the ability to learn and grow.
us-g3-mw-gm.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g3-mw-ei-lo1.name: Understand emotion intensity (a little mad vs. very angry)
us-g3-mw-ei-lo1.description: Students will understand that emotions can vary in intensity (e.g., a little mad vs. very angry).
us-g3-mw-ei-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g3-mw-sm-lo1.name: Identify what stress feels like in the body
us-g3-mw-sm-lo1.description: Students will be able to identify physical sensations associated with stress.
us-g3-mw-sm-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g3-mw-hr-lo1.name: Understand friendship qualities and boundaries
us-g3-mw-hr-lo1.description: Students will understand qualities of healthy friendships and the importance of personal boundaries.
us-g3-mw-hr-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g3-mw-gm-lo1.name: Understand that brains can grow and change
us-g3-mw-gm-lo1.description: Students will understand the concept of neuroplasticity – that their brains can grow and change with effort.
us-g3-mw-gm-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g4-mw.name: Grade 4 Mental Wellness
us-g4-mw.description: Mental wellness skill development for Grade 4.
us-g4-mw.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g4-mw-sm.name: Stress Management
us-g4-mw-sm.description: Developing healthy ways to cope with stress.
us-g4-mw-sm.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g4-mw-gm.name: Growth Mindset
us-g4-mw-gm.description: Fostering a belief in the ability to learn and grow.
us-g4-mw-gm.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g4-mw-ei-lo1.name: Recognize emotional triggers and early warning signs
us-g4-mw-ei-lo1.description: Students will be able to recognize personal emotional triggers and early warning signs of escalating emotions.
us-g4-mw-ei-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g4-mw-sm-lo1.name: Practice multiple calming techniques (breathing, movement, visualization)
us-g4-mw-sm-lo1.description: Students will practice and identify effectiveness of multiple calming techniques (e.g., breathing exercises, physical movement, visualization).
us-g4-mw-sm-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g4-mw-hr-lo1.name: Practice conflict resolution with peer mediation
us-g4-mw-hr-lo1.description: Students will practice conflict resolution skills, potentially with peer mediation support.
us-g4-mw-hr-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g4-mw-gm-lo1.name: Set realistic goals and track progress
us-g4-mw-gm-lo1.description: Students will learn to set realistic short-term goals and track their progress towards them.
us-g4-mw-gm-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g5-mw.name: Grade 5 Mental Wellness
us-g5-mw.description: Mental wellness skill development for Grade 5.
us-g5-mw.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g5-mw-sm.name: Stress Management
us-g5-mw-sm.description: Developing healthy ways to cope with stress.
us-g5-mw-sm.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g5-mw-gm.name: Growth Mindset
us-g5-mw-gm.description: Fostering a belief in the ability to learn and grow.
us-g5-mw-gm.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g5-mw-ei-lo1.name: Develop emotional vocabulary (frustrated, disappointed, anxious)
us-g5-mw-ei-lo1.description: Students will develop a richer emotional vocabulary to describe nuanced feelings (e.g., frustrated, disappointed, anxious).
us-g5-mw-ei-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g5-mw-sm-lo1.name: Create personal stress management toolkit
us-g5-mw-sm-lo1.description: Students will create a personal toolkit of effective stress management strategies.
us-g5-mw-sm-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g5-mw-hr-lo1.name: Recognize and report unhealthy relationship patterns
us-g5-mw-hr-lo1.description: Students will learn to recognize signs of unhealthy relationship patterns and understand how to report them or seek help.
us-g5-mw-hr-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-g5-mw-gm-lo1.name: Learn from failure and seek feedback
us-g5-mw-gm-lo1.description: Students will learn to view failure as a learning opportunity and actively seek constructive feedback.
us-g5-mw-gm-lo1.subject: MENTAL_WELLNESS

us-spanish.name: World Languages: Spanish

us-g35-spanish.name: Grades 3-5 Spanish (Novice-Mid)
us-g35-spanish.description: Building on foundations with more complex sentences, questions, and cultural comparisons.
us-g35-spanish.subject: WORLD_LANGUAGES

us-g35-spanish-comm-lo1.name: Ask and answer simple questions about self and family.

us-g35-spanish-conn-lo1.name: Connect Spanish vocabulary to other subjects (e.g., numbers in Math, animals in Science).

us-g35-spanish-comp-lo1.name: Compare patterns of politeness between own culture and Spanish-speaking cultures.
us-g35-spanish-comp-lo1.subject: WORLD_LANGUAGES
